title: SimulatorCoder: DNN Accelerator Simulator Code Generation and Optimization via Large Language Models
data:
Y Xia, T Li, H Zhou, X Zhou, C Chen, R Zhang- arXiv preprint arXiv:2602.17169, 2026
This paper presents SimulatorCoder, an agent powered by large language models 
(LLMs), designed to generate and optimize deep neural network (DNN) accelerator 
simulators based on natural language descriptions. By integrating domain-specific

title: Empirical Analysis to Enhance Security of Information Platforms
data:
X Wang - 2025
Abstract Information platforms, technology systems designed for the collection, 
storage and processing of information, are evolving with critical concerns of security. 
To address the security threats, empirical analysis is widely utilized in various 
platforms. By systematic data collection on platform processing and user responses, 
the security risks and vulnerabilities of target information platforms can be assessed. 
In this dissertation, we apply this empirical approach to assess the security of three

individuals with intellectual disabilities (ID). While Large Language Models (LLMs)

title: Understanding How Developers Use LLMGenerated Refactoring Suggestions
data:
D Schn, F Amjad, T Asif - 2026
Large language models (LLMs) have gained widespread popularity and have 
steadily improved over time, enabling software developers to use them for coding 
tasks. One common task is code refactoring, where the chatbot suggests changes for 
the developer to apply. Although current research focuses on evaluating LLM-
generated refactoring suggestions, there is a limited understanding of how 
developers implement these suggestions in practice. To explore this, we analyze
